subject: History
title: Cleopatra's Lost Tomb
description: A short lesson to help you apply Cleopatra's Lost Tomb.

hook.text: Cleopatra VII, the last pharaoh, was buried with Mark Antony. Their tomb has never been found.

buildup.text: Ancient sources say they were buried together in a lavish mausoleum near the temple of Isis in Alexandria.

discovery.text: Alexandria has been rebuilt many times. Much of the ancient city is underwater, submerged by earthquakes and sea rise.

twist.text: Archaeologist Kathleen Martinez has spent 20 years searching the temple of Taposiris Magna and found promising tunnels.

climax.text: Finding Cleopatra's tomb would be the biggest archaeological discovery since Tutankhamunâ€”and it could still happen.

punchline.text: The last pharaoh is still waiting to be found.

quiz.question: Why is Cleopatra's tomb so difficult to locate?
options: She was cremated according to Greek tradition
Ancient Alexandria is largely underwater due to earthquakes and sea rise
Roman conquerors destroyed her tomb after her death
